009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalarSeparable;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
014import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
015
016import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Scalar and separable version of the Bilateral filter as proposed in [1]. On color images, this filter is applied
021 * separately to each color component. The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all image
022 * types. See Sec. 17.2 of [2] for additional details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images", Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE
026 * International Conference on Computer Vision, Bombay, India.
027 * <br>
028 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2021/01/01
034 */
035public class BilateralFilterScalarSeparable extends GenericFilterScalarSeparable implements BilateralF {
036        
037        private final float[] Hd;       // the 1D domain kernel
038        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
039        private final double sigmaR2;
040        
041        public BilateralFilterScalarSeparable() {
042                this(new Parameters());
043        }
044        
045        public BilateralFilterScalarSeparable(Parameters params) {
046                GaussianKernel1D kernel = new GaussianKernel1D(params.sigmaD);
047                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
048                this.K = kernel.getXc();
049                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
050        }
051        
052        // 1D filter in x-direction
053        @Override
054        protected float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
055                return filterXY(source, u, v, true);
056        }
057        
058        // 1D filter in y-direction
059        @Override
060        protected float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
061                return filterXY(source, u, v, false);
062        }
063        
064        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
065        
066        private float filterXY(PixelSlice source, int u, int v, boolean isX) {
067                float a = source.getVal(u, v);
068                float S = 0;
069                float W = 0;
070                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
071                        float b = (isX) ? source.getVal(u + m, v) : source.getVal(u, v + m);
072                        float wd = Hd[m + K];                           // domain weight
073                        float wr = gauss(a - b, sigmaR2);       // range weight
074                        float w = wd * wr;
075                        S = S + w * b;
076                        W = W + w;
077                }
078                return S / W;
079        }
080        
081        private float gauss(double x, double sigma2) {
082                return (float) Math.exp(-(x * x) / (2 * sigma2));
083        }
084        
085}
